trans-unit.source: Keep the UI thread responsive
trans-unit.target: Keep the UI thread responsive

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Users expect an app to remain responsive while it does computation, regardless of the type of machine.
trans-unit.target: Users expect an app to remain responsive while it does computation, regardless of the type of machine.

trans-unit.source: This means different things for different apps.
trans-unit.target: This means different things for different apps.

trans-unit.source: For some, this translates to providing more realistic physics, loading data from disk or the web faster, quickly presenting complex scenes and navigating between pages, finding directions in a snap, or rapidly processing data.
trans-unit.target: For some, this translates to providing more realistic physics, loading data from disk or the web faster, quickly presenting complex scenes and navigating between pages, finding directions in a snap, or rapidly processing data.

trans-unit.source: Regardless of the type of computation, users want their app to act on their input and eliminate instances where it appears unresponsive while it "thinks".
trans-unit.target: Regardless of the type of computation, users want their app to act on their input and eliminate instances where it appears unresponsive while it "thinks".

trans-unit.source: Your app is event-driven, which means that your code performs work in response to an event and then it sits idle until the next.
trans-unit.target: Your app is event-driven, which means that your code performs work in response to an event and then it sits idle until the next.

trans-unit.source: Platform code for UI (layout, input, raising events, etc.) and your app’s code for UI all are executed on the same UI thread.
trans-unit.target: Platform code for UI (layout, input, raising events, etc.) and your app’s code for UI all are executed on the same UI thread.

trans-unit.source: Only one instruction can execute on that thread at a time so if your app code takes too long to process an event then the framework can’t run layout or raise new events representing user interaction.
trans-unit.target: Only one instruction can execute on that thread at a time so if your app code takes too long to process an event then the framework can’t run layout or raise new events representing user interaction.

trans-unit.source: The responsiveness of your app is related to the availability of the UI thread to process work.
trans-unit.target: The responsiveness of your app is related to the availability of the UI thread to process work.

trans-unit.source: You need to use the UI thread to make almost all changes to the UI thread, including creating UI types and accessing their members.
trans-unit.target: You need to use the UI thread to make almost all changes to the UI thread, including creating UI types and accessing their members.

trans-unit.source: You can't update the UI from a background thread but you can post a message to it with [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh750317) to cause code to be run there.
trans-unit.target: You can't update the UI from a background thread but you can post a message to it with [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh750317) to cause code to be run there.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The one exception is that there's a separate render thread that can apply UI changes that won't affect how input is handled or the basic layout.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The one exception is that there's a separate render thread that can apply UI changes that won't affect how input is handled or the basic layout.

trans-unit.source: For example many animations and transitions that don’t affect layout can run on this render thread.
trans-unit.target: For example many animations and transitions that don’t affect layout can run on this render thread.

trans-unit.source: Delay element instantiation
trans-unit.target: Delay element instantiation

trans-unit.source: Some of the slowest stages in an app can include startup, and switching views.
trans-unit.target: Some of the slowest stages in an app can include startup, and switching views.

trans-unit.source: Don't do more work than necessary to bring up the UI that the user sees initially.
trans-unit.target: Don't do more work than necessary to bring up the UI that the user sees initially.

trans-unit.source: For example, don't create the UI for progressively-disclosed UI and the contents of popups.
trans-unit.target: For example, don't create the UI for progressively-disclosed UI and the contents of popups.

trans-unit.source: Use [x:DeferLoadStrategy](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt204785) to delay-instantiate elements.
trans-unit.target: Use [x:DeferLoadStrategy](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt204785) to delay-instantiate elements.

trans-unit.source: Programmatically insert elements into the tree on-demand.
trans-unit.target: Programmatically insert elements into the tree on-demand.

trans-unit.source: [**CoreDispatcher.RunIdleAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967918) queues work for the UI thread to process when it's not busy.
trans-unit.target: [**CoreDispatcher.RunIdleAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967918) queues work for the UI thread to process when it's not busy.

trans-unit.source: Use asynchronous APIs
trans-unit.target: Use asynchronous APIs

trans-unit.source: To help keep your app responsive, the platform provides asynchronous versions of many of its APIs.
trans-unit.target: To help keep your app responsive, the platform provides asynchronous versions of many of its APIs.

trans-unit.source: An asynchronous API ensures that your active execution thread never blocks for a significant amount of time.
trans-unit.target: An asynchronous API ensures that your active execution thread never blocks for a significant amount of time.

trans-unit.source: When you call an API from the UI thread, use the asynchronous version if it's available.
trans-unit.target: When you call an API from the UI thread, use the asynchronous version if it's available.

trans-unit.source: For more info about programming with **async** patterns, see [Asynchronous programming](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt187335) or [Call asynchronous APIs in C\# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt187337).
trans-unit.target: For more info about programming with **async** patterns, see [Asynchronous programming](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt187335) or [Call asynchronous APIs in C\# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt187337).

trans-unit.source: Offload work to background threads
trans-unit.target: Offload work to background threads

trans-unit.source: Write event handlers to return quickly.
trans-unit.target: Write event handlers to return quickly.

trans-unit.source: In cases where a non-trivial amount of work needs to be performed, schedule it on a background thread and return.
trans-unit.target: In cases where a non-trivial amount of work needs to be performed, schedule it on a background thread and return.

trans-unit.source: You can schedule work asynchronously by using the **await** operator in C\#, the **Await** operator in Visual Basic, or delegates in C++.
trans-unit.target: You can schedule work asynchronously by using the **await** operator in C\#, the **Await** operator in Visual Basic, or delegates in C++.

trans-unit.source: But this doesn't guarantee that the work you schedule will run on a background thread.
trans-unit.target: But this doesn't guarantee that the work you schedule will run on a background thread.

trans-unit.source: Many of the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) APIs schedule work in the background thread for you, but if you call your app code by using only **await** or a delegate, you run that delegate or method on the UI thread.
trans-unit.target: Many of the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) APIs schedule work in the background thread for you, but if you call your app code by using only **await** or a delegate, you run that delegate or method on the UI thread.

trans-unit.source: You have to explicitly say when you want to run your app code on a background thread.
trans-unit.target: You have to explicitly say when you want to run your app code on a background thread.

trans-unit.source: In C\#C\# and Visual Basic you can accomplish this by passing code to [**Task.Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.threading.tasks.task.run.aspx).
trans-unit.target: In C\#C\# and Visual Basic you can accomplish this by passing code to [**Task.Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.threading.tasks.task.run.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Remember that UI elements may only be accessed from the UI thread.
trans-unit.target: Remember that UI elements may only be accessed from the UI thread.

trans-unit.source: Use the UI thread to access UI elements before launching the background work and/or use [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh750317) or [**CoreDispatcher.RunIdleAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967918) on the background thread.
trans-unit.target: Use the UI thread to access UI elements before launching the background work and/or use [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh750317) or [**CoreDispatcher.RunIdleAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967918) on the background thread.

trans-unit.source: An example of work that can be performed on a background thread is the calculating of computer AI in a game.
trans-unit.target: An example of work that can be performed on a background thread is the calculating of computer AI in a game.

trans-unit.source: The code that calculates the computer's next move can take a lot of time to execute.
trans-unit.target: The code that calculates the computer's next move can take a lot of time to execute.
